intro: Scorzonera kozlowskyi, commonly known as the Kozlovsky's scorzonera, is a flowering plant native to Central Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its hairy stems and yellow to orange flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or arid environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh conditions. Its leaves are usually lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, which help reduce water loss. Scorzonera kozlowskyi is also noted for its underground tubers, which are sometimes used in traditional medicine.
